thread.title: Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship
thread.title_full: Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship

title: Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship
text:
Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship Storm go 4-0 in their own Sauk Rapids Invitational, beating Cloquet in the final Post to Facebook Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship Storm go 4-0 in their own Sauk Rapids Invitational, beating Cloquet in the final Check out this story on sctimes.com: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/10/prep-volleyball-roundup-storm-capture-championship/73764400/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Prep volleyball roundup: Storm capture championship TIMES STAFF REPORT 10:44 p.m. CDT October 10, 2015 Volleyball 
SAUK RAPIDS — The Sauk Rapids volleyball team won the six-team Sauk Rapids Invitational on Saturday. 
Sauk Rapids beat Pequot Lakes (25-22,24-26, 15-7) and Robbinsdale Cooper (25-11, 25-15) in pool play. 
The Storm then defeated Kimball (25-21, 25-16) in the bracket semifinals and knocked off Cloquet (25-7, 23-25, 15-13) in the championship match. 
Pequot Lakes took third and Kimball was fourth. Cooper took fifth and Minneapolis Patrick Henry finished sixth. 
For the day, Sauk Rapids received 46 kills from Kyra Harvey, including four ace serves. Bailey Becker added 22 kills. Angela Konz had nine blocks. Kahlen Manthey had 37 digs. Morgan Held 61 set assists and Miranda Bowman added 42. 
For Kimball, Stephanie Hurrle had nine ace serves and 24 set assists. Kari Schiefelbein had six ace serves and 19 digs. Madison Hurrle had 27 kills and 8.5 blocks and Mackenzie Leither added 13 kills. Caitlin O’Brien had six blocks and Becky Holtz had 39 set assists. 
Pool A results 
Kimball def. Minneapolis Patrick Henry 25-7, 25-9 
Cloquet def. Kimball 25-22, 25-22 
Cloquet def. Patrick Henry 25-8, 25-16 
Pool B results 
Pequot Lakes def. Robbinsdale Cooper 25-12, 23-25, 15-11 
Sauk Rapids def. Pequot Lakes 22-25, 26-24, 15-7 
Pequot Lakes def. Cooper 25-12, 23-25, 15-11 
Semifinals 
Cloquet def. Pequot Lakes 25-19, 25-22 
Sauk Rapids def. Kimball 25-21, 25-16 
Final 
Sauk Rapids def. Cloquet 25-7, 23-25, 15-13 
Third-place match 
Pequot Lakes def. Kimball 25-19, 25-21 
Fifth-place match 
Cooper def. Patrick Henry 25-14, 25-13 
ROCORI WINS ALEX TITLE 
ALEXANDRIA –– The Rocori Spartans captured the tournament championship with a 2-0 win over Grand Rapids. 
Eleanor Holthaus led the way for Rocori with 41 kills, 39 set assists, 25 digs and six blocks throughout the tournament. 
Morgan Holthaus collected 25 kills, 52 set assists and 27 digs for the Spartans (22-1). Abby Templin notched 22 kills and five ace serves for Rocori. 
The Spartans defeated Mounds View (2-0), Belgrade-Brooten-Elrosa (2-1) and North St. Paul (2-1) en route to the championship. 
The Belgrade-Brooten-Elrosa Jaguars finished 2-2 at the tournament. 
Karlee Kern led B-B-E with 21 kills over the four matches. 
The Jaguars defeated Mounds View 2-1 and beat North St. Paul 2-1. B-B-E’s losses were 2-1 to Rocori and Alexandria. 
MELROSE GOES 2-3 
PERHAM –– Sophomore Mia Meyer led Melrose with 22 kills and 13 blocks in the Perham Tournament. The Dutchmen lost in the semifinals to Perham 25-13, 25-12. 
Melrose beat Frazee (25-21, 25-15) and Dilworth-Glyndon-Felton (25-21, 26-24) and lost to Park Rapids (26-24, 25-21) and Roseau (25-17, 25-19). 
Rose Johnson had 50 set assists and Ann Bitz added 39. Sandra Sprenger had 43 digs. 
SAUK CENTRE GOES 3-1 
PERHAM –– Sauk Centre won three pool play matches and advanced to the semifinals, where it lost 2-1 to Roseau. 
The Mainstreeters were led by senior Rebecca Weir, who recorded 47 kills and 16 blocks in the tournament. Jill Klaphake collected 95 set assists, 25 digs and eight ace serves for Sauk Centre (11-0 West Central, 21-3 overall). 
In addition, Morgan Gamradt had 10 kills, 31 digs and 10 ace serves and Taylor Borgerding added 16 kills for the Mainstreeters. 
FLYERS ARE 3-1-2 AT TOURNEY 
LONG PRAIRIE –– Little Falls went 3-1-2 in the Long Prairie-Grey Eagle Tournament and was led by Melanie Dorn, who had 13 kills on the day. 
Laura Fregin tallied 13 ace serves and Kacy Steinmetz added 44 set assists for the Flyers. 
Little Falls defeated Ogilvie, Staples-Motley and Pine River. The Flyers tied Long Prairie-Grey Eagle and Upsala with their lone defeat coming against Annandale.
